edu.mbhs.madubozhi.touhou.game.util

Class InputHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.mbhs.madubozhi.touhou.game.util.InputHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class InputHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener
    Handles the user's keyboard inputs and translates them into inputs usable by game objects
    Author:
    bowenzhi and mattdu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InputHandler(java.awt.Component comp)
      Initiates a new instance of itself as a KeyListener

      Returns the rgt boolean value
      boolean getShoot()
      Returns the shoot boolean value
      void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      keyPressed event: adjusts different values according to which keys are pressed down Allows for simultaneous input translation
      void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      keyReleased event: unadjusts different values according to which keys are pressed down Allows for simultaneous input translation
      void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      keyTyped event: has no use, since keyReleased and keyPressed are both implemented
      boolean offBomb()
      Returns the offBomb boolean value
